bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 30 (Thursday, February 15, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BIGGS:H.R. 5046.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution[Page H1213]

item.name: Higher Education and Workforce Development Subcomittee
Higher Education and Workforce Development Subcomittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education and Workforce Development.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.name: National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities

summary.text:
Defund National Endowment for the Humanities Act of 2018

This bill prohibits the use of any funds that are made available to the National Endowment for the Humanities of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities to carry out the functions, programs, and activities of such endowment.

bill.title: Defund National Endowment for the Humanities Act of 2018

item.title: Defund National Endowment for the Humanities Act of 2018

To provide that none of the funds made available to the National Endowment for the Humanities for any fiscal year may be used to carry out section 7 of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act of 1965.
Defund National Endowment for the Humanities Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education and Workforce Development.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
